intro: Streblosa undulata, commonly known as the wavy streblosa, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive wavy, undulating leaves that give it its scientific name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens for its ornamental value.
